segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 3
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 3

segments.pli: 10. Loṇakapallavagga
segments.en: 10. A Lump of Salt

segments.pli: 99. Potthakasutta
segments.en: 99. Jute

segments.pli: “Navopi, bhikkhave, potthako dubbaṇṇo ca hoti dukkhasamphasso ca appaggho ca;
segments.en: “Jute canvas is ugly, unpleasant to touch, and worthless whether it’s new, worn in, or worn out.

segments.pli: majjhimopi, bhikkhave, potthako dubbaṇṇo ca hoti dukkhasamphasso ca appaggho ca;
jiṇṇopi, bhikkhave, potthako dubbaṇṇo ca hoti dukkhasamphasso ca appaggho ca.
Jiṇṇampi, bhikkhave, potthakaṃ ukkhaliparimajjanaṃ vā karonti saṅkārakūṭe vā naṃ chaḍḍenti.
segments.en: They use worn out jute canvas for scrubbing pots, or else they just throw it away on the rubbish heap.

segments.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, navo cepi bhikkhu hoti dussīlo pāpadhammo.
segments.en: In the same way, if a junior mendicant is unethical, of bad character,

segments.pli: Idamassa dubbaṇṇatāya vadāmi.
segments.en: this is how they’re ugly, I say.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi so, bhikkhave, potthako dubbaṇṇo tathūpamāhaṃ, bhikkhave, imaṃ puggalaṃ vadāmi.
segments.en: That person is just as ugly as jute canvas.

segments.pli: Ye kho panassa sevanti bhajanti payirupāsanti diṭṭhānugatiṃ āpajjanti, tesaṃ taṃ hoti dīgharattaṃ ahitāya dukkhāya.
segments.en: If you associate with, accompany, and attend to that person, following their example, it’ll be for your lasting harm and suffering.

segments.pli: Idamassa dukkhasamphassatāya vadāmi.
segments.en: This is how they’re unpleasant to touch, I say.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi so, bhikkhave, potthako dukkhasamphasso tathūpamāhaṃ, bhikkhave, imaṃ puggalaṃ vadāmi.
segments.en: That person is just as unpleasant to touch as jute canvas.

segments.pli: Yesaṃ kho pana so paṭiggaṇhāti cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhāraṃ, tesaṃ taṃ na mahapphalaṃ hoti na mahānisaṃsaṃ.
segments.en: Any robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick that they receive are not very fruitful or beneficial for the donor.

segments.pli: Idamassa appagghatāya vadāmi.
segments.en: This is how they’re worthless, I say.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi so, bhikkhave, potthako appaggho tathūpamāhaṃ, bhikkhave, imaṃ puggalaṃ vadāmi.
segments.en: That person is just as worthless as jute canvas.

segments.pli: Majjhimo cepi, bhikkhave, bhikkhu hoti … pe …
segments.en: If a middle mendicant is unethical, of bad character, this is how they’re ugly, I say. …

segments.pli: thero cepi, bhikkhave, bhikkhu hoti dussīlo pāpadhammo, idamassa dubbaṇṇatāya vadāmi.
segments.en: If a senior mendicant is unethical, of bad character, this is how they’re ugly, I say. …

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi so, bhikkhave, potthako dubbaṇṇo tathūpamāhaṃ, bhikkhave, imaṃ puggalaṃ vadāmi.
Ye kho panassa sevanti bhajanti payirupāsanti diṭṭhānugatiṃ āpajjanti, tesaṃ taṃ hoti dīgharattaṃ ahitāya dukkhāya.
segments.en: If you associate with, accompany, and attend to that person, following their example, it’ll be for your lasting harm and suffering. …

segments.pli: Idamassa dukkhasamphassatāya vadāmi.
Seyyathāpi so, bhikkhave, potthako dukkhasamphasso tathūpamāhaṃ, bhikkhave, imaṃ puggalaṃ vadāmi.
Yesaṃ kho pana so paṭiggaṇhāti cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhāraṃ, tesaṃ taṃ na mahapphalaṃ hoti na mahānisaṃsaṃ.
Idamassa appagghatāya vadāmi.
Seyyathāpi so, bhikkhave, potthako appaggho tathūpamāhaṃ, bhikkhave, imaṃ puggalaṃ vadāmi.
Evarūpo cāyaṃ, bhikkhave, thero bhikkhu saṅghamajjhe bhaṇati.
segments.en: If such a senior mendicant speaks among the Saṅgha,

segments.pli: Tamenaṃ bhikkhū evamāhaṃsu:
segments.en: the mendicants say:

segments.pli: ‘kiṃ nu kho tuyhaṃ bālassa abyattassa bhaṇitena,
segments.en: ‘What’s an incompetent fool like you got to say?

segments.pli: tvampi nāma bhaṇitabbaṃ maññasī’ti.
segments.en: How on earth could you imagine you’ve got something worth saying!’

segments.pli: So kupito anattamano tathārūpiṃ vācaṃ nicchāreti yathārūpāya vācāya saṅgho taṃ ukkhipati, saṅkārakūṭeva naṃ potthakaṃ.
segments.en: That person becomes angry and upset, and blurts out things that make the Saṅgha throw them out, as if they were throwing jute canvas away on the rubbish heap.

segments.pli: Navampi, bhikkhave, kāsikaṃ vatthaṃ vaṇṇavantañceva hoti sukhasamphassañca mahagghañca; majjhimampi, bhikkhave, kāsikaṃ vatthaṃ vaṇṇavantañceva hoti sukhasamphassañca mahagghañca; jiṇṇampi, bhikkhave, kāsikaṃ vatthaṃ vaṇṇavantañceva hoti sukhasamphassañca mahagghañca.
segments.en: Cloth from Kāsī is beautiful, pleasant to touch, and valuable whether it’s new, worn in, or worn out.

segments.pli: Jiṇṇampi, bhikkhave, kāsikaṃ vatthaṃ ratanapaliveṭhanaṃ vā karoti gandhakaraṇḍake vā naṃ pakkhipanti.
segments.en: They use worn out cloth from Kāsī for wrapping, or else they place it in a fragrant casket.

segments.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, navo cepi bhikkhu hoti sīlavā kalyāṇadhammo, idamassa suvaṇṇatāya vadāmi.
segments.en: In the same way, if a junior mendicant is ethical, of good character, this is how they’re beautiful, I say.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi taṃ, bhikkhave, kāsikaṃ vatthaṃ vaṇṇavantaṃ tathūpamāhaṃ, bhikkhave, imaṃ puggalaṃ vadāmi.
segments.en: That person is just as beautiful as cloth from Kāsī.

segments.pli: Ye kho panassa sevanti bhajanti payirupāsanti diṭṭhānugatiṃ āpajjanti, tesaṃ taṃ hoti dīgharattaṃ hitāya sukhāya.
segments.en: If you associate with, accompany, and attend to such a person, following their example, it will be for your lasting welfare and happiness.

segments.pli: Idamassa sukhasamphassatāya vadāmi.
segments.en: This is how they’re pleasant to touch, I say.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi taṃ, bhikkhave, kāsikaṃ vatthaṃ sukhasamphassaṃ tathūpamāhaṃ, bhikkhave, imaṃ puggalaṃ vadāmi.
segments.en: That person is just as pleasant to touch as cloth from Kāsī.

segments.pli: Yesaṃ kho pana so paṭiggaṇhāti cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhāraṃ, tesaṃ taṃ mahapphalaṃ hoti mahānisaṃsaṃ.
segments.en: Any robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick that they receive are very fruitful and beneficial for the donor.

segments.pli: Idamassa mahagghatāya vadāmi.
segments.en: This is how they’re valuable, I say.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi taṃ, bhikkhave, kāsikaṃ vatthaṃ mahagghaṃ tathūpamāhaṃ, bhikkhave, imaṃ puggalaṃ vadāmi.
segments.en: That person is just as valuable as cloth from Kāsī.

segments.pli: Majjhimo cepi, bhikkhave, bhikkhu hoti … pe …
segments.en: If a middle mendicant is ethical, of good character, this is how they’re beautiful, I say. …

segments.pli: thero cepi, bhikkhave, bhikkhu hoti … pe … puggalaṃ vadāmi.
segments.en: If a senior mendicant is ethical, of good character, this is how they’re beautiful, I say. …

segments.pli: Evarūpo cāyaṃ, bhikkhave, thero bhikkhu saṃghamajjhe bhaṇati.
segments.en: If such a senior mendicant speaks in the midst of the Saṅgha,

segments.pli: Tamenaṃ bhikkhū evamāhaṃsu:
segments.en: the mendicants say:

segments.pli: ‘appasaddā āyasmanto hotha, thero bhikkhu dhammañca vinayañca bhaṇatī’ti.
segments.en: ‘Venerables, be quiet! The senior mendicant is speaking on the teaching and training.’

segments.pli: Tasmātiha, bhikkhave, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ:
segments.en: So you should train like this:

segments.pli: ‘kāsikavatthūpamā bhavissāma, na potthakūpamā’ti.
segments.en: ‘We will be like cloth from Kāsī, not like jute canvas.’

segments.pli: Evañhi vo, bhikkhave, sikkhitabban”ti.
segments.en: That’s how you should train.”

segments.pli: Aṭṭhamaṃ.

sections.title: “Jute canvas is ugly, unpleasant to touch, and worthless…

suttaplex.blurb: A bad mendicant is ugly and rough like jute canvas.
